## Many innovation opportunities

- **Efficient datascience** stack: databases, automation, dataviz
- Generalization of state-of-the-art **open source tools**
  - secure and **well-supported** by a community
  - **interoperable**, rely on **standards**
- Non-traditional **new (big) data sources**
- In the world fast-evolving **AI/ML**
- Promote collaboration between diverse actors
- Build a community


# How to achieve this?

## Fundamental principles

![](img/platform-believes2.svg){height="600" fig-align="center"}

## Open innovation 
<br>
Open Innovation acts as **a bridge** between internal teams and outside networks

- **Share** knowledge and resources
- Wider pool of **new ideas and technologies**
- **Mitigates risks** associated with new product development
- **Cost savings**
- Higher-quality products that **better meet users needs**


## Fostering best practices

- Autonomy
- Reproducibility
- Separation of code, data and execution environment 

![](img/best_practices.png){height="350" fig-align="center"}


# Use cases

## Use case: promote cooperation

- A **common infrastructure** outside local IT
- Access to **standardized** environments
- Fit for work on **open data**

![](img/mutualize.svg){height="350" fig-align="center"}


## Use case: a project show room

- **Dissemination** of new ideas and experimental work
- Allows **one-click test** of advanced technologies / tools
